title: Change of Condition — Chest Pain / Suspected ACS Protocol (LTC/SNF)
summary: A triage workflow for chest pain or suspected myocardial ischemia: symptom screen, red flags, immediate escalation, and documentation elements.

sections.heading: Recognize heart attack warning signs
sections.body: Chest discomfort (pressure/squeezing/fullness/pain) that lasts more than a few minutes or comes and goes; discomfort in arm(s), back, neck, jaw, or stomach; shortness of breath; nausea, lightheadedness, or cold sweat.

sections.heading: Immediate actions (do not delay)
sections.body: 1) Assess ABCs and current symptoms. 2) Obtain vitals and oxygen saturation. 3) Call 911/activate emergency response per facility protocol if symptoms concerning for ACS or resident unstable. 4) Notify provider with SBAR. 5) Follow standing orders only if they exist (e.g., oxygen, aspirin, nitroglycerin) and only as ordered/allowed by your facility policy.

sections.heading: Red flags
sections.body: Severe/ongoing chest pain, shortness of breath, syncope, hypotension, new confusion, diaphoresis, or any unstable vital signs should trigger immediate emergency response per protocol.

sections.heading: Documentation elements (survey-ready)
sections.body: Document: onset time; pain location/quality/radiation/0-10; associated symptoms; vitals and SpO2; interventions per orders; notifications (EMS/provider/representative) with times; resident response and disposition.
